articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Number of coronavirus cases skyrockets in China
articles.description: Health officials in China are now reporting more than 100 deaths and more than 4,500 cases -- up nearly 60% from yesterday.

articles.author: David K. Li, Erika Edwards
articles.title: United cancels flights to and from China as CDC steps up coronavirus screenings
articles.description: United Airlines canceled 24 U.S. flights to and from China, and the U.S. Department of Health & Human Services announced it would increase the number of American ports of entry with screening for coronavirus.
articles.content:
United Airlines canceled two dozen U.S. flights to and from China, the carrier announced Tuesday, as American health authorities stepped up efforts to battle the fast-spreading coronavirus.

articles.title: Coronavirus risk in U.S. 'remains low' even as federal officials take steps to protect public
articles.description: The risk of coronavirus cases spreading in the U.S. remains low. Asymptomatic transmission may be possible but symptomatic transmission is what causes outbreaks.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Health secretary on coronavirus: 'Americans should not worry for their own safety'
articles.description: Top U.S. health officials held a press conference on the coronavirus outbreak. The U.S. will expand screening of passengers from China to 20 airports while a vaccine is in the works.

articles.title: Coronavirus in the U.S.: Map of where the virus has been confirmed across the country

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: This American teacher chose to stay behind in Wuhan. Here’s why.
articles.description: Doug Perez, 28, chose to remain in Wuhan, China, where the novel coronavirus originated, rather than be evacuated from the city along with other U.S. nationals.
